resources.string: Enables broadcasting of panic messages by SMS and MMS
Enables broadcasting of panic messages via mail account
Enables GPS, location and accelerometer standby mode
Allows Panic Service to resume in its\' last state if the phone is restarted
This should be as frequently as possible while balancing battery usage.
This should be frequently enough to keep the GPS updated so that resolving the location in panic mode is quicker.
Allows you to use the camera(s) on your device to capture video.
When enabled, a panic will switch the camera LED on when using your device rear-facing camera.
Allows your cameras to capture still images during a panic.
The LED will flash when a still picture is taken.
This will capture audio using any available microphones when a panic is triggered.
More than 1 microphone can be selected if preferred.
Provides an audible alarm in the event of a panic that will sound out over the speakers.
Forces the audible alarm to play at maximum volume over the speakers.
Will notify you via the notification system what is happening with the Panic Alarm service.
When enabled, will prevent any obvious sign that the Panic Service is working. See help for further details.
This will use GPS satellites and mobile networks wherever possible to broadcast your device location.
This will enable GPS location broadcasting in a special vigilance mode so that if a panic is triggered, the location is available immediately.
This will let you trigger a panic using the power button on your device.
The maximum is 5. It is advisable to set this to 3 or higher.
This will allow your headphone playback/answer trigger button to trigger a panic.
It is advisable to set this to 3 or higher (provided it does not conflict with the settings used on any playback apps you may use).
Allows sudden changes in accelerometer state (e.g. dropping a phone) to trigger a panic.
Determines the trigger sensitivity of accelerometer. Tap here to launch a wizard to do this.
